intro: Mitrasacme novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand mitrasacme, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a short stem, lance-shaped leaves, and showy, pinkish-white blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
